footer_desc: Bringing the world's most iconic historical sites to your living room using cutting-edge WebAR technology.
footer_copyright_slogan: Preserving the Past, Shaping the Future.

home.hero_desc: Experience the world's architectural wonders in high-performance WebAR. No apps required.
home.guide_desc: Follow these simple steps to bring historical monuments into your personal space.
home.step_1_desc: Choose any monument from our collection and click 'Explore in AR'.
home.step_2_desc: Open the link on your smartphone (Android or iOS) for the best experience.
home.step_3_desc: Point your camera at a flat surface like a floor or table and move it slowly.
home.step_4_desc: The model will appear! You can pinch to zoom or drag to rotate and move it.
home.sys_req_desc: Works best on Chrome (Android) and Safari (iOS). Ensure your device supports Google Play Services for AR or Apple ARKit.

sites.borobudur_desc: Borobudur is a 9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Magelang Regency, Central Java, Indonesia. It is the world's largest Buddhist temple and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, decorated with 2,672 relief panels and 504 Buddha statues.
sites.petra_desc: Al-Khazneh is one of the most elaborate temples in Petra, a city of the Nabataean Kingdom inhabited by the Arabs in ancient times. Carved out of a sandstone rock face.
sites.great_wall_desc: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications built across the historical northern borders of ancient Chinese states. It is the longest man-made structure in the world.
sites.pyramids_desc: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the largest Egyptian pyramid and the tomb of Fourth Dynasty pharaoh Khufu. Built in the early 26th century BC, it is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
sites.angkor_wat_desc: Angkor Wat is a temple complex in Cambodia and is the largest religious monument in the world by land area. Originally a Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu, transformed into a Buddhist temple.
sites.pisa_tower_desc: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is the freestanding bell tower of the cathedral of the Italian city of Pisa, known worldwide for its nearly four-degree lean due to an unstable foundation.
sites.arc_de_triomphe_desc: The Arc de Triomphe honours those who fought and died for France in the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars. It stands at the western end of the Champs-Élysées.
sites.eiffel_tower_desc: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, named after engineer Gustave Eiffel whose company designed and built the tower from 1887 to 1889.
sites.colosseum_st_peters_desc: A magnificent collection representing the peak of Roman architecture and the heart of the Vatican. This model showcases the grandeur of the Roman amphitheatre alongside St. Peter's Basilica.
